text: Almost all hubl supported variables are. Exception being request vars
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
Hey Chris, no definitive timeline but we are working on this actively. Hopefully very soon :crossed_fingers: :smile_cat:

Just discovered that Firefox doesn’t like embedded HubSpot forms. Using the embed code in a HubSpot site template I get a CORS error and this message in console:
```
Loading failed for the <script> with source "<https://forms.hsforms.com/embed/v3/form/>…".
```
All other browsers seem okay, but it’s a bit of a dealbreaker not being able to load some vital forms.
have a link for the sake of curiosity?
what is not loading? i am not getting an error
:shrug:
The larger form comes from elsewhere, but the email subscribe one is from a HubSpot embed script.
I’m confused!!!
i am seeing that one show up
also, if you click submit, i get the modal takeover.  is that correct?
Yes, not my idea :speak_no_evil:
ha
What v of FF are you using?
try the ff dev edition and see if it works.  again, just out of curiosity
Dev edition lets it render.
well damn
I’m going to try resetting my standard edition FF.
:eyes:
Let me know if the reset works Grant, if not, ill pass this along inside and see whats going on
Crazy, after a full refresh plus profile prefs dump it seems to be working again.
Hopefully it was a just a complete anomaly for me. Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2> and <@UD53A9UUR> - really appreciate the look in.

Hello all, does anyone know if it’s possible to sort a related blog post listing by publish date?
I’m using the macro in this article <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-a-related-post-listing>
And would something like this work? is there
{% related_blog_posts | sort(true, false, ‘publish_date’) …. %}
Hello everyone, was wondering if anyone can assist me in displaying the rest of my blog listings.  Right now its only showing the 3.  Here is the page it is on.  <https://www.arundo.com/thejourney>
you are limiting it with that `if loop.index` business.  that is saying give me posts 2,3 and 4
How would I have to rewrite the for loop to get all to show?  Thanks for your help.
remove that if statement
remove line 3 and line 27 from that  file
thanks for your help dennis, I did remove it and its only showing 5 now.  I removed it before and similar thing happened so I assumed I was doing something wrong.
<https://www.arundo.com/thejourney>
you should also look in your blog settings.  you can change how many posts it prints per page there
settings  - website - blog - template: number of posts per listing page
okay let me ck
ah doh!, that was it.  simple solution.  thanks!
:slightly_smiling_face:
